title: 111_s1111
content: The Act titled "Special Disability Workload Liability Resolution Act of 2009" addresses the payment of Medicare liability to states resulting from the Special Disability Workload Project. The Secretary, in consultation with the Commissioner, will work with each State to agree on a payment related to Medicare program liability within 6 months of the Act's enactment. The Secretary will pay the State within 30 days of reaching an agreement, using $4 billion appropriated for fiscal year 2010. The Secretary will make payments to States under certain limitations, not exceeding $4 billion. The payment amount is based on Federal data, including proxies and estimates, considering factors like eligible SDW cases under Medicare. The Secretary will make payments to States under certain limitations, not exceeding $4 billion, based on factors like eligible SDW cases under Medicare and the non-Federal share of Medicaid expenditures. States must waive the right to file civil actions for payment related to Medicare. The United States releases the State from Medicare liability under title XVIII of the Social Security Act as a result of the Special Disability Workload project. States are not required to submit individual claims data. States must submit individual claims for Medicaid payments to receive payment under this section. Ineligible states involved in civil actions seeking payment related to Medicare liability are not eligible for payments under this section. The term "Commissioner" refers to the Commissioner of Social Security, and "Medicaid program" refers to the Medicaid program. The term "Medicaid program" refers to the program of medical assistance under title XIX of the Social Security Act, including waivers approved under sections 1115 or 1915. The term "Medicare program" refers to the program under title XVIII of the Social Security Act. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Health and Human Services. The term "SDW case" refers to a case in the Special Disability Workload project involving individuals eligible for benefits under title II of the Social Security Act. The term "State" refers to each of the 50 States and the District of Columbia. The "Special Disability Workload project" is described in the 2008 Annual Report of the Board of Trustees of the Federal Old-Age and Survivors Insurance and Federal Disability Insurance Trust Funds.
